abstracts.cdata!:
The Fifth Kabupaten Roads Project
            achieved most of its objectives, the result considered
            satisfactory, with a likely sustainability. Still, key
            lessons address the need to strengthen local capacity, not
            only through technical assistance, which alone has limited
            impact, but through appropriate civil service reforms, to
            avoid the losses experienced in productivity, and output,
            resulting from inexperienced officials, field consultants,
            and contractors. This was exacerbated by the lack of
            practical training, monitoring, and, non-supportive local
            governments in establishing strong local capacities.
            Consequently, construction quality suffered due to poor
            quality control, and related institutional arrangements,
            which diminished the effect on the lifetime of works, and of
            course on the economic rate of return. Unfortunately,
            incentives to encourage equipment ownership by contractors,
            were not successful, neither were the interim steps taken to
            introduce equipment privatization workshops, nor the use of
            rational equipment rental rates. Hence, all income had to be
            returned to the local government, where currently, adequate
            equipment funding is not guaranteed. This reflects the need
            to extend, and improve the pilot program for equipment
            management workshop, under future highway projects. But the
            long-term solution to this, lies in encouraging banks
            lending to local contractors.

18218539.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
18218539.theme: Environmental policies and institutions,Rural services and infrastructure,Urban services and housing for the poor
18218539.majtheme: Environment and natural resource management,Rural development,Urban development

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will improve access to the
            main economic centers for the agriculture dependent rural
            population in project kabupatens located in Central, East
            and South Kalimantan, Maluku, and Riau, and to consolidate
            the current efforts to strengthen all agencies in the
            country dealing with kabupaten roads. The project includes
            the following main components: (a) a road network
            improvement component, subdivided into three subcomponents:
            (i) road works and supervision for the maintenance of an
            increasing share of the maintainable part of the kabupaten
            road network as well as rehabilitation of selected roads in
            project kabupatens over three fiscal years starting in
            1994/95; (ii) workshops and laboratories upgrading and
            equipping; (iii) provision of equipment, spare parts and
            supplies; and (b) technical assistance and studies for
            strengthening systems and procedures for planning,
            environmental analysis, quality assurance, and for helping
            the agencies of the Government of Indonesia in the
            implementation and monitoring of the project.
